unnormalised: My grandma, Lakshmi Amma, swore by Ayurveda! She lived to be 95! Every Onam, she'd tell us stories of her panchakarma treatments in Kerala. She even walked 5 km daily well into her 80s. She always said her health was thanks to the Vaidyaratnam Ayurveda College and their traditional remedies. I'm now thinking of trying Abhyanga myself. Maybe it can help with my back pain; modern medicine only provides temporary relief. Anyone else had good experiences in Bangalore or Chennai?
